quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [to Toby, who's filming] You fallin' behind.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: [jumps in front of camera] Wuphf.com!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Ryan, we're doing the dance!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: This is how you build a business. This is how you make it in this country.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: [Bluetooth rings] You got Creed.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: -and you jump in front of them.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: You make it so hard to love you sometimes.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Still behind.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [closing door] I said I didn't want to be on the internet!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Go, go, go, go!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [performs magic-tricks while lip-syncing]

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.line: Streamers! [everyone throws streamers in the air and starts dancing]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hiya! Ha! [climbs on Phyllis' desk and starts kicking things off, bites off the head of a stuffed animal]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Dwight! [Dwight pulls out a hunting knife and jumps off desk]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Are you crazy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [song ends] Toby, how did we do?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Well, that was better.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Whoo! We did it! [everyone starts cheering]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I suppose summer had to end sometime. It's sad, though, because I had a great summer. I got West Nile virus, lost a ton of weight. Then I went back to the lake. I stepped on a piece of glass in the parking lot, which hurt. That got infected even though I peed on it. Saw 'Inception.' Or at least I dreamt I did.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Brocolli Rob, obviously, will be there.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Yes, of course.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: And JC. We call him Blorville, because he looks like a black Orville Redenbacher.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Who's the guy who invented the peanut?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Hey, guys.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Sorry, didn't mean to interrupt.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Not at all.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: I'm gonna head back to Siberia there. Ciao. [he and Erin kiss]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: I started dating Erin this summer. It has been, in a word, exquisite.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Gabe is awesome. He has accomplished so much career-wise and height-wise. Thank God he's my boss because I would not have said yes to a first date if I didn't have to, but... it's been great.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Am I angry that Gabe stole my girlfriend over the summer? No. I've been through anger-management, OK? So right now, I am sitting on a nice beach at Cape Cod, gazing out across the whitecaps. Oh, look, it's a humpback whale. How pretty. He's eating Gabe.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [goes to change thermostat as Dwight puts a locked cover over it] Hey. What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: From now on, if you're hot, sit on an ice pack.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Well, what if you're cold?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Like you'd ever be cold, Kevin. Stop asking me hypothetical questions, OK? I'm too busy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey, Dwight, I don't know if you heard, but we're supposed to be drinking out of weird backpacks instead of cups, like regular people.  Oh, you did hear.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [drinking from Camelback] Jim, you have one job to do. And you do it forgettably.  Those of us who are busy require hands-free hydration.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Dwight Schrute, star salesman, beet farmer, bed-and-breakfast proprietor, aspiring freelance bodyguard. Add to that list owner of this building. Then burn the list.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: This summer, I did the minority executive training program at Yale. You guys, I'm, like, really smart now. You don't even know. You could ask me, "Kelly, what's the biggest company in the world?" And I'd be like, "blah blah blah, blah blah blah blah blah blah," giving you the exact right answer.

quotes.speaker: Luke
quotes.line: Coffee Monkey's arrived.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: The coffee's supposed to be here at 9.

quotes.speaker: Luke
quotes.line: Here you go, Big O. Tiny. [hands Kevin his coffee] Darryl Hannah.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: It says decaf. You get me decaf?

quotes.speaker: Luke
quotes.line: Ooh, yeah. Must've been some sort of mix-up there. You could just drink it, or I could drive all the way back?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: My summer, I, um, blew out my knee playing softball. Ended up watching CNN most of the time. I don't know how we're going to get out of Afghanistan. I hate the new assistant. He's only been here for a week, and I hate him.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: New guy sucks. Calls me the Nard-Man. I'm the Nard-Dog, okay? Nard-man is my father.

quotes.speaker: Luke
quotes.line: My name is Luke Cooper. I love cinema. My favorite movies are Citizen Kane and The Boondock Saints.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: That kid is the worst. Needs to be fired, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: He's not the worst, okay? He's not the worst. You know who's the worst? That intern we had a few years ago. That guy-remember? Eeeh! That face, how ugly he was? He was the worst. Good worker, though. [starts drinking coffee] Ah! It's not cappuccino.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: He messed yours up to.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: He's got to go, Mike.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's just coffee, guys! But, yeah, I'll look into it, okay?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wow, that's a lot of keys.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: The bigger the key chain, the more powerful the man.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's right. The janitor said that. By the way, the raccoons are back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Where?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I think they run through these panels and then down under the map. I wouldn't know for sure cause I don't have a trained ear. That's why I have to use one of these. [pulls out stethoscope]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Give me that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yep. Wait, and this. [hands Dwight a hammer]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Go get 'em.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What happened to me this summer? Dwight bought the building, so actually, this has been the busiest summer of my life.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [Jim quietly takes Dwight's keychain and starts adding keys to it, Pam giggles] Hey, what's so funny over here? Ha. Very nice. Give me my keys. [removes keys and throws them at Jim] Ha. Ha. Not. Funny. Jim.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, no. Don't worry about it. I was just gonna put a couple keys on it every day until Christmas. Then his pants would have fallen down, which was a little gift to me, but...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: It was really funny.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well, it would have been. So unprofessional, Mrs. Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I love you.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Luke? Luke!

quotes.speaker: Luke
quotes.line: What's up, Venus?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Did you send those samples to Justin at Lehigh Motors yesterday? Because he didn't get 'em.

quotes.speaker: Luke
quotes.line: Uh, if you asked me to do it, I'm sure I did it. Yeah, strawberries are ripe.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Hey, turn off the Chumbawamba and scram, twerp.

quotes.speaker: Luke
quotes.line: You don't have to yell.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, rude. Luke, I want you to go to the supermarket for me.

quotes.speaker: Luke
quotes.line: What for?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: To get some ice cream for everybody. It's national ice cream afternoon. Great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And another thing I did this summer, I hired my nephew.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Having Luke here is a pretty big deal for me, because his mother, who also happens to be my half-sister, kind of cut me off from that side of the family 15 years  a-  14. The last time I saw Luke was the opening day of 'Ace Ventura II' and that was '95, so yes, 15 years on the dot. Anyway, I lost him in a forest.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Don't bother Luke.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Why is there a circle with a line through it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That means don't. Haven't you seen Ghostbusters, Pam?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Yeah, but it's like you're saying we should bother Luke.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, it... Yes, okay, right. [erases don't] All right, yep. My bad. I got it. Here we go. [writes "Don't"  in front of symbol]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Don't don't bother Luke. Got it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Come on. Okay, um... [draws a circle around "Don't" with a line through it] That's as clear as I can make it.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Hey, why can't we bother Luke? He deserves it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Because I don't want it getting back to Sabre that we're yelling at assistants. I think it would reflect poorly on us.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Who's gonna tell on us? Gabe?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: That'd be hilarious. Uh, "Jo, they're creating a hostile work environment. Stop  'em."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Nope, it won't be Gabe but actually, there is somebody in the office that is very, very close to Luke.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: How close?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, Dwight, he wiped his butt. Is that close enough for you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes. Of course.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Guys, I think Michael and Luke are related.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No. No, Toby. He's not. Yes he is. He's my nephew.

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Luke is my nephew.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Michael, that's nepotism. Luke is getting special treatment because he's your nephew.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes, exactly. That is a very nice way of putting it, Oscar. Mixing family and business is a beautiful thing.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: What's wrong with a level playing field?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Do you think they should have had open auditions for the band Hanson? What if no one named Hanson showed up? That wouldn't even make sense. Or what if they just hired the littlest kid and a 50-year-old guy who was a murderer? Really safe.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, man, so many points being made.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: I couldn't care less about nepotism. But, I'm loving the debate. Great minds battling it out. And I've got a front row seat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: God, when he needed help on Earth, who did he hire? Jesus Christ, his son.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: That's a really tight argument.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: But you're comparing you and Luke to God and Jesus.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No! No. I'm just saying, why does God get to do something that I don't?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: This is hypothetical. We're talking about Luke who happens to be terrible.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, then, why aren't you bugging me to fire everybody who's bad? You just want me to fire Luke. That's reverse nepotism.  He should not be punished because he is related to me and bad at what he does!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I would just like to say something off of what Darryl said about the level playing field. That is actually a zoning issue. So, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: If there's nothing wrong with this, Michael, why have you been keeping it a secret?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Because I wanted you to come to me and say, "Wow, he is so great." And I was gonna say, "Well, it's in the genes." And I was actually gonna be wearing jeans. And I'd point to them, right? No. But you ruined it. So, thank you very much. Here he comes. Guys, look. I don't want you to treat him like anyone else in the office. I just want you to treat him like my nephew. Hey, there he is.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Hey! Ice cream afternoon!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Whoo! Whoo! Whoo!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Wait, soy ice cream? Did you get real ice cream?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Or enough for everyone?

quotes.speaker: Luke
quotes.line: No, man. There was no list. Uh, but I got bagel chips.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Ah, my favorite part of an ice cream party. The bagel chips.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Clutch cream run, bro.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Get whatever you want, on me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You really think you can make it up to me with food?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I don't know. That usually works.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I feel horrible for blowing Jim's prank. I don't know if you can tell, but he's mildly upset. And Dwight hasn't been messed with in a while, so he's become a monster. I need to make this right.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I came down here to feed the feral cats like I usually do and I found something unsavory in the back of your nephew's car.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok, you know what? Just -just back off! Back off!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Well, take a look. It's all the packages he was supposed to overnight. He never bothered to send them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All right, those might be his. He might own an Ebay store.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yep. That's exactly what my first thought was. And then I remembered having a conversation with him where he was like, "I don't own an Ebay store," so...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok, ok. You know what? This is disgusting. This is like a witch hunt. This is like the Blair Witch Hunt project.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Oh sure, those are the expense reports that corporate was waiting for yesterday.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Let's just make this kid open this damn car.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Oh my gosh, those are the pants he wanted to return to Talbots.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm reconsidering sending them back anyway.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: You get that kid to open this car, or I'm gonna do it myself... by calling Tripple A.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Wait a minute.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: [breaks into the car] I'm in.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Don't-all right. Well, ok, you've just committed a felony.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Yep, here they are.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Yep, I just lost a client cause I swore I sent these samples on time.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: This kid's costing us sales, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: I'm sorry, do you want to try them on again to see.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, I know they fit. It's not about the fit.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Why is this my problem, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Because Gabe tattled. I was perfectly happy to just hide it from you.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Those overnight packages needed to go out, and Michael refuses to hold the guilty party accountable.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Lower yourself, Gabe. I don't wanna be having a conversation with your crotch. Ok, educate me now why you won't fire the boy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You don't have all the facts.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Which are?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I love him.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Oh, God. How far has it gone?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No. No. He's my nephew.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Well, I got a nephew too. But he don't work for me. You know why? Cause he's a screw-up. He can swim in my pool but he can't come in my house.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, this office is my pool. And my house is my house. And I just want my nephew to work in my pool.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: If you keep him, Michael, I'm gonna hold you accountable for him. You're on the hook for this kid. You got that? Cover his ass like tighty-whities.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I will cover his ass like moss on a Mississippi tree stump.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.line: Was how I put it not clear enough? I mean, you had to go and make up your own saying? Deal with it, boys.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Luke and I have been working side-by-side as master and commander. Me as master, he as commander. Occasionally he will need a little push, and I will do that, and he'll slow down, and I'll push him again. That's the thing with kids, you have to keep pushing. You have to push them until they push you back. And then you push some more. It's all about give and take, but mostly it's about pushing each other.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Oh, yeah. This'll be easy. So just, like, rearrange the buttons and stuff.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, yeah. Like when he presses "Doors closed" the doors open. Or he presses "lobby" it goes to third floor, stuff like that. Can you do that?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah. Let me take a look at the circus board.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Dwight is about to get so Pammed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hey, did you SMS text message me?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, I wanted to show you something in the lobby. Come on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [as elevator doors won't shut] Okay, that's weird. Just hitting "door closed." What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: There we go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Is this elevator going up? Hey, the elevator is disobeying us! [elevator stops between floors]  Okay, okay. We are stuck. We are stuck. Hank, Hank! Can you hear us? Oh, my God. Okay. Emergency protocol.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Let's just calm down.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Pam, try and pry open those front doors, immediately.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I don't-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Use your talons! Pry 'em open! [starts to urinate in elevator corner]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Ok, Dwi-Oh, my God!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well, don't look, freak!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Dwight, what are you doing!? We've only been in here for, like, two seconds!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I've got 56 ounces of fluid in my bladder! And we have to establish a pee corner!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You've gotta be kidding me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Luke is going to use his laser pointer to point to account setup. You click on that first, then a whole new-Not, no, no, no! [Luke points laser at Oscar's forehead] Luke, come on. Come on. Not on Oscar's head. Alright. Luke, come on. Stop it!

quotes.speaker: Luke
quotes.line: What? I'm stopping it. That's what you said.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Give me the pointer.

quotes.speaker: Luke
quotes.line: So you just want me to move it? You're being totally unclear here. I'm just gonna go ahead and move it. [points it at Angela's chest]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, just power it down. No, no, no, no, no. Not on Angela's boob. Come on. Come on. Luke, seriously.

quotes.speaker: Luke
quotes.line: All right, fine. Fine. I'll just go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Luke
quotes.line: I'm gone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All right. Okay. Good job. Okay, email accounts. So we're starting with account setup-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh, my God, is it in my eyeball? I think he's burning my eye.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Michael, do something.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Sack up, man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, can I have that?

quotes.speaker: Luke
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ok, I am going to count down from five.

quotes.speaker: Both
quotes.line: Five, four...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm not kidding.

quotes.speaker: Both
quotes.line: Three, two, one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Give-okay. Alright, give it up.

quotes.speaker: Luke
quotes.line: No!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [bending Luke over desk, spanking him repeatedly] You are going to learn to be more professional, Luke!

quotes.speaker: Luke
quotes.line: What the?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's what you're going to do, Luke!

quotes.speaker: Luke
quotes.line: What the hell was that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I had to do that.

quotes.speaker: Luke
quotes.line: Hey, [bleep] this! Screw it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All right. Are we good? [Luke runs out crying] You're okay. He's okay. There are many different schools of thought on capital punishment.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: That was awesome!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Texas justice.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Yeah, your nephew is so lame.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: He's been trashing us relentlessly on Twitter. Yeah, it's funny stuff, but mean.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You follow him on Twitter?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Everywhere I look it's Betty White this and Betty White that. Finally a kid that's not talking about Betty White. Of course I follow him.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Michael, you just physically assaulted an employee. Can we talk in private?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes, of course. What is this in reference to?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, hey Jim. Some prankster switched the elevator buttons on Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I did not do this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I know. Yeah, and it was going really great at first. I got video.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: This is impressive.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Well, you know... they don't call me the Bart Simpson of Scranton for nothing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Do they call you that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: They do call me that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Come on, give me your hand. I'll help you down.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Nope. Scared of getting cut in half. Also, there's pee on the floor.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh! Of course there is. Hey, Chinese tonight?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: How ya doin'?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Pretty good. You must be almost out of water.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Stop drinking the water! Stop!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [Phyllis and Andy act out Luke getting spanked] No, no, no, no. It's the other hand. Right hand. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Would have been nice to work with my family. It would have been nice if Luke had been able to stay here. But he couldn't. These things seldom work out. I don't know how Ringling Brothers do it. Night after night, town after town, all across America. You would think they'd be sick of each other by now. But, clearly, they make it work. And my hat's off to them.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [Dwight starts aggressively spanking Andy] Whoa! Whoa! Hey. Whoa. Dwight! Stop!

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Legal says the best way to protect us from a lawsuit is to call this a stress-induced outburst.  You will have to undergo six sessions of counseling.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's it? Really? That's nothing. All right. That's highway robbery.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Good. Well, that's the spirit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I can do that.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: And, uh, you will do your counseling right here, because our HR staff are all certified counselors.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay. Wait, what?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Yeah, I'm really looking forward to working with you, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Is there another option?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: The alternative is termination. [Michael stares off, considering termination...]
